Hero.description: Front-end Developer graduated in Computer Engineering, with 3+ years of experience. I have been prominently engaged at MB Labs for over a year, contributing to large-scale projects and working with advanced technologies. I possess strong skills in CSS frameworks (Chakra UI, Bootstrap, Ant Design), Redux, Zustand, Context, Next.js, Server Components, React Query, and other technologies related to React. I am always committed to improving my front-end skills. Welcome to my webpage, where I share knowledge and projects!

descriptions.B&T: Technology company operating in the foreign exchange market. I work on the development of a payment management system, using key technologies such as React, JavaScript, Redux, and Material-UI.
descriptions.Cinemark: A company that needs no introduction. I initially worked on the development and revamping of the new website, using major technologies such as Next.js 13, Chakra UI, React Query, and Zustand.
descriptions.CargoPlace: Cargo transportation company. I work on application development, using key technologies like Next.js, Context API, and Chakra UI.
descriptions.Arco: Arco, an education company. I work on application development, using key technologies like Next.js, Context API, and Chakra UI.
descriptions.Marvin: Full Stack Developer at Marvin, a real estate company. I work on application development, using key technologies like React, JavaScript, Redux, and Material-UI.
descriptions.Zap: Back-end Developer at Zap, a delivery company. I work on application development, using key technologies like Node.js.

Tutorials.title: Tutorials
Tutorials.description: Follow tutorials on key resources for building modern web applications using Next.js.

jest.title: Testing with Jest
jest.description: Jest is a JavaScript testing framework designed to ensure correctness of any JavaScript codebase. It allows you to write tests with an approachable, familiar and feature-rich API that gives you results quickly.
jest.unitDescription: Unit tests are tests that verify that a unit of code (function, class, component) works as expected. They are very important to ensure that the code works correctly and does not break when new features are added. Let's see how the tests are applied in our example project.
jest.whatToTestDescription: The first thing we must do is identify what must be tested. During the development of this project I had a bug when refactoring the CardWithImageOverlay component. The component is currently being used in two different places, the home page and the tutorials page. When refactoring the component, I accidentally broke the component on the homepage in a way that the bottom button wasn't with the correct string (access or soon). To prevent this from happening again, let's write a test to ensure the component works as expected everywhere it's used.

githubActions.title: GitHub Actions
githubActions.description: GitHub Actions makes it easy to automate all your software workflows, now with world-class CI/CD. Build, test, and deploy your code right from GitHub. Make code reviews, branch management, and issue triaging work the way you want.
